de.esoco.lib.comm.http

Class HttpRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.lib.comm.http.HttpRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class HttpRequest
extends org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
    A class that collects the data of an HTTP request and additional information (like headers) in it's relations.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Creates a new instance.
      HttpRequest(java.io.InputStream rInput, int nMaxLineLength)
      Reads the incoming request and throws an exception if it doesn't match the requirements.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpRequest

        public HttpRequest(java.io.InputStream rInput,
                   int nMaxLineLength)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   HttpStatusException
        Reads the incoming request and throws an exception if it doesn't match the requirements.
        Parameters:
        rInput - rInputReader The reader to read the request from
        nMaxLineLength - The maximum length a request header line (terminated with CRLF) is allowed to have
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If reading from the input fails
        HttpStatusException - The corresponding HTTP status if the request violates requirements

      • HttpRequest

        public HttpRequest(HttpRequestMethod rRequestMethod,
                   java.lang.String rRequestPath,
                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> rRequestHeaders,
                   java.io.Reader rRequestBodyReader)
        Creates a new instance.
        Parameters:
        rRequestMethod - The request method
        rRequestPath - The request path
        rRequestHeaders - The request headers
        rRequestBodyReader - The reader that given access to the request body (if applicable)

    • Method Detail

      • getBody

        public final java.lang.String getBody()
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the complete body of this request by reading it from the reader returned by getBodyReader(). The maximum length to be read will be taken from the HttpHeaderTypes.CONTENT_LENGTH relation type which will be automatically set if the request is read from the input stream.
        Returns:
        A string containing the full body text
        Throws:
        HttpStatusException - HttpStatusCode.LENGTH_REQUIRED if no content length is provided
        java.io.IOException - If reading the body content fails

      • getBodyReader

        public final java.io.Reader getBodyReader()
        Returns a reader that provides the body of the request. Will be yield no data (but will never be NULL) if the request has no body. The relation HttpHeaderTypes.CONTENT_LENGTH will contain the length of the body data.
        Returns:
        A reader that provides the body data

      • getHeaderField

        public final java.util.List<java.lang.String> getHeaderField(java.lang.String sName)
        Returns the value of a header field in this request.
        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the header field
        Returns:
        The header field value or NULL if the header is not set

      • getHeaderField

        public final java.util.List<java.lang.String> getHeaderField(HttpHeaderTypes.HttpHeaderField eField)
        Returns the value of a header field in this request. Invokes the method getHeaderField(String) with the field name.
        Parameters:
        eField - sName The header field
        Returns:
        The header field value or NULL if the header is not set

      • getMethod

        public final HttpRequestMethod getMethod()
        Returns the request method.
        Returns:
        The request method

      • getPath

        public final java.lang.String getPath()
        Returns the requested path.
        Returns:
        The requested path

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class org.obrel.core.RelatedObject

      • parseRequestHeader

        protected void parseRequestHeader(java.lang.String sHeaderName,
                                  java.lang.String sHeaderValue)
                           throws HttpStatusException
        Tries to set an HTTP request header field as a relation on this instance. Invokes HttpHeaderTypes.get(String) with the given header name and if successfull tries to parse the value with Conversions.parseValue(String, Class) with the relation datatype.
        Parameters:
        sHeaderName - The name of the header field
        sHeaderValue - The value of the header field
        Throws:
        HttpStatusException - If the field value could not be parsed

      • readHeaders

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> readHeaders(java.io.Reader rInputReader)
                                                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                       HttpStatusException
        Reads the request headers into a map and returns it.
        Parameters:
        rInputReader - The reader to read the header fields from
        Returns:
        A mapping from header field names to field values
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On stream acces failures
        HttpStatusException - On malformed requests

      • readLine

        protected java.lang.String readLine(java.io.Reader rReader)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Helper method to read a single HTTP request line (terminated with CRLF) from a Reader.
        Parameters:
        rReader - The reader to read the line from
        Returns:
        The line string or NULL if no terminating CRLF could be found
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If reading data fails
        HttpStatusException - If the line is not terminated correctly
